snippet: A utility spokesman said union officials would have to agree to give warning before striking so that the company would not be unprepared.
abstract: Consolidated Edison and its biggest union both agree to meet with federal mediators in hopes of restarting negotiations on a new contract; development comes one day after the utility company locked out 8,000 workers, leaving managers and contractors to maintain electrical lines.
lead_paragraph: A utility spokesman said union officials would have to agree to give warning before striking so that the company would not be unprepared.

headline.seo: Con Edison and Locked-Out Union to Talk Thursday
headline.main: Con Edison and Chief Union to Resume Talks on Thursday
headline.print_headline: Con Ed and Union, Pressed, Plan to Meet With Mediators
